channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Ugly Remnant of Preserved Tree on Council Land in front of my House, 7th August
item.description:
It is now over 4.5 years since I first asked for this tree to be removed. Over a year ago, you did come to fell the very ugly remains of the preserved tree on the strip of Council land in front of our house. However, there was a bees nest in the tree that prevented any work. I now believe that the bees have left the tree as I have not seen any for a few months. I did observe a large swarm going down the gap between 6 and 6A heading South. So perhaps now you could remove this ugly remnant of the once very attractive preserved tree. Regards Andrew Heron 01242 521161

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6a, The Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Surface of footpath has deteriorated over many years. This is near junction of Gloucester Road and Station Road Andoversford. I, 7th August
item.description:
Condition was reported to the Parish Council in July 2017 and now worse Uneven parts of pavement and loose stones etc with dip in pavement which holds water after rain Pavement much used by children going to and from school, plus elderly. Dry difficult when pushing pram or using a wheeled walking aid. I now consider the pavement surface dangerous. Sorry unable to photograph at this time. Please help. Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
